title: Prayer for relief
text: A prayer for relief, in the <a href="law">law</a> of <a href="civil%20procedure">civil procedure</a>, is a portion of a <a href="complaint%20%28law%29">complaint</a> in which the <a href="plaintiff">plaintiff</a> describes the remedies that the plaintiff seeks from the court. For example, the plaintiff may ask for an award of <a href="compensatory%20damages">compensatory damages</a>, <a href="punitive%20damages">punitive damages</a>, <a href="attorney%27s%20fees">attorney's fees</a>, an <a href="injunction">injunction</a> to make the defendant stop a certain activity, or all of these. The request for a specific amount of money may be referred to as an <a href="ad%20quod%20damnum">ad damnum clause</a>.
